name: wl-equsal1t
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, wff w0
body: |- wi(wnf(s0, w0), wb(wal(s0, wi(wceq(cv(s0), cv(s1)), w0)), w0))

stmt.origin: wl-equsald(s0, s1, wnf(s0, w0), w0, w0)
stmt.pretty: wl-equsald(s0, s1, F/(s0, w0), w0, w0)

-| wnf(s0, wnf(s0, w0))
-| wi(wnf(s0, w0), wnf(s0, w0))

comment: The expression ` x = y ` in antecedent position plays an important role in predicate logic, namely in implicit substitution. However, occasionally it is irrelevant, and can safely be dropped. A sufficient condition for this is when ` x ` (or ` y ` or both) is not free in ` ph ` . This theorem is more fundamental than ~ equsal , ~ spimt or ~ sbft , to which it is related. (Contributed by Wolf Lammen, 19-Aug-2018.)
